roleset.name: move in circular fashion, cause to be coiled
roleset.note: WIND-V NOTES: Verbnet classes coil-9.6 knead-26.5 meander-47.7 pit-10.7 roll-51.3.1, other framed members include: roll (coil); climb, drop, run, turn, wander (meander); move, roll (roll). Also comparison to 'end_up' for one of the 'wind_up' senses. (from wind.01-v)

role.descr: secondary attribute of arg1, end state/position

example.name: all args
example.text: John wound his watch very tight.

example.name: another example with arg2
example.text: John wound the string around his finger.

roleset.name: wind up: result in a condition

example.name: arg2 as vp
example.text: One way out of that dilemma could be a partial recapitalization in which the pilots would wind up sharing the value of their concessions with public shareholders.
example.arg: sharing the value of their concessions with public shareholders

example.name: arg2 as thing
example.text: As part of what a Recognition spokeswoman termed an ``amiable agreement,'' Prospect Group will wind up with control of top management posts and an increased stake in the maker of data management equipment.
example.arg: As part of what a Recognition spokeswoman termed an ``amiable agreement
with control of top management posts and an increased stake in the maker of data management equipment

roleset.name: wind up: move in circular fashion, cause to be coiled, tightly coild, stressed, anxious
roleset.note: WIND_UP-V NOTES: Can you say this?Also "John wound his watch up". (from wind.03-v)
WOUND_UP-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on SMS. (from wound.03-j)

example.name: all args
example.text: John wound up his watch very tight.

roleset.name: wind up: bring to an end

role.descr: entity causing something else to stop

example.name: let's wind this up
example.text: In Boston , Edwin Booth was winding up a performance of A New Way [0] [*]To Pay Old Debts [*T*-1] .
example.arg: a performance of A New Way [0] [*]To Pay Old Debts [*T*-1]

roleset.name: wind down: come/bring to a stop

role.descr: entity causing something else to stop

example.name: transitive, unstated agent
example.text: The plan may include *trace* selling branches, consolidating or eliminating departments, and winding down *trace*-1 or disposing of [unprofitable units]-1 within 18 months.

example.name: ergative
example.text: Only a week ago, when airline buy-out fever was already winding down...
